thread.title: Top 12 college soccer teams in the DMV
thread.title_full: Top 12 college soccer teams in the DMV

title: Top 12 college soccer teams in the DMV
text:
Top 12 college soccer teams in the DMV Resize Text By Steven Goff October 19 at 3:14 PM Follow @soccerinsider (UVA) 
Last week, we spotlighted the 12 teams in the DMV (D.C., Maryland, Virginia) in the best form . This week, we look at the 12 best teams, regardless of gender. It’s a power ranking, of sorts. This list, however, is not suggesting that, for instance, the George Washington women would defeat the American University men. It’s to recognize teams that have performed at a high level heading into the last stretch of the regular season. 
The NCAA tournaments will begin Nov. 13 (women) and Nov. 19 (men), culminating with the College Cups on Dec. 4-6 in Cary, N.C. (women) and Dec. 11-13 in Kansas City, Kan. (men). 
1. Virginia women : 11-1-1 overall, 5-1-0 in ACC. Four consecutive victories since overtime defeat to Notre Dame. Makenzy Doniak tied Angela Hucles for the program record in career points (138). [ My preseason feature on Doniak and her family .] Next: Louisville on Thursday, top-ranked Florida State on Sunday. 
2. Georgetown men : 9-2-2 overall, 5-0-0 in Big East. Seven consecutive victories, unbeaten in 10 straight, five shutouts in a row with freshman goalkeeper J.T. Marcinkowski. Next: at St. John’s on Saturday. 
3. Maryland men : 6-3-4 overall, 2-1-3 in Big Ten. Unbeaten in three straight for second place behind Penn State in conference. Freshman Sebastian Elney has team-high 6 goals. Next: Delaware on Tuesday, University of Washington on Friday. 
4. Virginia men : 8-3-2 overall, 3-2-1 in ACC. Defending NCAA champions rebounded from pair of losses with a 3-1 comeback victory over Pittsburgh. Next: at Virginia Tech on Friday. 
5. Virginia Tech women : 13-2-1 overall, 5-2-0 in ACC. Began three-game home stretch with 3-0 victory over Miami. Next: top-ranked Florida State on Thursday, Pittsburgh on Sunday. 
6. Old Dominion men : 7-2-1 overall, 3-1-1 in Conference USA. Eight-game unbeaten streak stopped at Florida International, 2-1, on two late goals. Next: at UNC Wilmington on Wednesday, Kentucky on Saturday. 
7. George Washington women : 11-4-0 overall, 6-0-0 in Atlantic 10. Won at Richmond, 1-0, on Sofia Pavon’s 80th-minute free kick, set program record for consecutive victories (nine). Next: Fordham on Thursday, at George Mason on Sunday. 
8. American men : 9-4-2 overall, 2-2-1 in Patriot League. Extended unbeaten streak and shutout streak to four matches with 0-0 draw at Army. Next: Bucknell on Saturday. 
9. William & Mary women : 11-3-1 overall, 5-1-0 in CAA. Five straight wins, four consecutive shutouts. Next: at Towson on Friday, at James Madison on Sunday. 
10. Georgetown women : 9-5-1 overall, 3-1-1 in Big East. 5-1-1 streak. Despite 11 vs. 10 advantage, conceded 2 goals in 95 seconds to settle for 2-2 draw with Marquette. Next: Seton Hall on Thursday, at DePaul on Sunday. 
11. Radford men : 10-2-1 overall, 5-1-1 in Big South. 7-1-0 in past eight matches, first place in conference. Next: Liberty on Tuesday, at Gardner-Webb on Friday. 
12. Navy women : 8-4-4 overall, 2-0-4 in Patriot League. Extended unbeaten streak to nine with 3-1 victory over Colgate. Next: at American on Wednesday, at Lafayette on Sunday. Steven Goff is The Post’s soccer writer. His beats include D.C. United, MLS and the international game, as well as local college basketball. sports Success! Check your inbox for details.
